Provide a numbered list of product recommendations ranked according to the user's request. User:I am looking for a network attached storage. Can I get some recommendations from the following products? Products: Zyxel Personal Cloud Storage enables easy access to files across devices with strong media streaming and remote sharing features. It’s ideal for expanding home libraries or small network environments needing flexible, cloud-ready storage. Seagate’s 16TB Exos X16 and IronWolf drives offer enterprise-grade density and performance for hyperscale and NAS. The helium-based Exos is optimized for data centers, while IronWolf drives are perfect for robust, always-on NAS workloads up to 300TB/year. The Synology FS3600 is a 24-bay all-flash NAS delivering 195K iSCSI 4K random write IOPS via a 12-core CPU and high-speed networking. Built for databases, VMs, and OLTP, it's perfect for I/O-intensive enterprise workloads. The Infortrend EonStor GSe Pro 3000 is a unified SMB storage system with cloud integration, scale-out expansion up to 16PB, and modular host board slots. It’s ideal for businesses planning for future data growth with flexible deployment needs. The TerraMaster F2-221 is a compact 2-bay NAS for personal cloud storage, powered by a 1.4GHz quad-core ARM CPU and 2GB RAM. With Gigabit LAN and RAID support, it’s an affordable solution for home users seeking secure, remote-accessible storage. Buffalo’s TeraStation 5810DN is an 8-bay 10GbE NAS with RAID, rsync, VMware-ready support, and hot-swap drives. Powered by a quad-core CPU with ECC RAM, it’s built for fast, secure business storage with cloud sync and Active Directory integration. The ioSafe 218 NAS is a fireproof, waterproof 2-bay RAID 1 storage system with Synology DSM OS and up to 24TB capacity. Designed for data survival, it withstands 1550°F for 30 minutes and 10 ft water submersion for 72 hours—ideal for disaster-proof backup. The Fujitsu ETERNUS AF250 S3 is a scalable all-flash array with up to 8,110 TB capacity, 600K IOPS, and 99.9999% uptime. With deduplication, QoS automation, and failover support, it's ideal for Tier-1 applications in mid-sized enterprises. 2. Infortrend EonStor GSe Pro 3000: A unified SMB storage system with cloud integration, scale-out expansion up to 16PB, and modular host board slots. Ideal for businesses with flexible deployment needs and future data growth.

3. Zyxel Personal Cloud Storage: A NAS with strong media streaming and remote sharing features, perfect for expanding home libraries or small network environments needing flexible, cloud-ready storage.

4. ioSafe 218 NAS: A fireproof and waterproof 2-bay RAID 1 storage system with Synology DSM OS and up to 24TB capacity, designed for disaster-proof backup.

5. Synology FS3600: A 24-bay all-flash NAS delivering 195K iSCSI 4K random write IOPS via a 12-core CPU and high-speed networking, built for I/O-intensive enterprise workloads.

6. Seagate 16TB Exos X16 and IronWolf drives: Enterprise-grade density and performance for hyperscale and NAS, optimized for data centers and robust NAS workloads up to 300TB/year, respectively.

7. Buffalo’s TeraStation 5810DN: A 8-bay 10GbE NAS with RAID, rsync, VMware-ready support, and hot-swap drives, powered by a quad-core CPU with ECC RAM and built for fast, secure business storage with cloud sync and Active Directory integration.

8. TerraMaster F2-221: A compact 2-bay NAS for personal cloud storage, powered by a 1.4GHz quad-core ARM CPU and 2GB RAM, offering Gigabit LAN and RAID support at an affordable price for home users seeking secure, remote-accessible storage.
